title: Smoother Simpler Biondi?
content:
Hi trying to find a fond with these characteristics. Particularly like the "G".

Thanks for your keen eye ; -)

Sara

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812im_/http:/typophile.com/files/headline%20font_3903.jpg)
author: sarafina

comments.content: Looks like a heavy weight of their own corporate font called "gleneagles" as seen on [their website](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.gleneagles.com/) as Light.
That could be. In fact pretty likely ; -) But I feel as if I have seen it or something similar to it elsewhere. Ring a bell for anyone?

Mini serifed heavy sans was used as a design feature cira 1900. Sometimes called flareserif. A few modern uses of tiny serifs similar to the sample:  
Steve Zafarana's Alphdog [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tailspinstudio/alph-dog/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/tailspinstudio/alph-dog/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/tailspinstudio/alph-dog/"),  
Jim Parkinson's Modesto [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto/"),  
Leslie Usherwood and Steve Jackaman's Alexon [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/alexon-rr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/alexon-rr/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/alexon-rr/")  
Phil Martin's Agenda by URW [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/agenda/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/agenda/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/agenda/") which makes use of the same serifs but only for about half the usual locations.  
Don

"gleneagles" font is copyrighted to [Sedley Place](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.sedley-place.com/home/our-work/graphic-design/the-gleneagles-hotel.aspx).  
Adding to Don's suggestions: [Quorum](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/quorum), [Newtext](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/newtext), [Laudatio](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/laudatio-bq), [Symbol](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/symbol), [Havenbrook](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aah-yes/havenbrook), [Cantoria](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/cantoria-mt), [Lady Copra Alternate](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.dafont.com/lady-copra.font), [Beaufort](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017130812/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/beaufort)

You guys rock ; -)

Modesto looks good and beaufort works as well!

Thanks for your help!!

Sara
